Dear Ms. Adrianse:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
10/03/24. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Samantha Way, Area Manager, at 517-243-9743.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
701 S. Elmwood
Traverse City, MI 49684

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• Rule 400.12415 (a) Incident reports. Discussed the requirement that
incident reports are to be submitted to the consultant. Only those incidents
named under the rule are to be submitted.
• DCWL review of Corrective Action Plans (CAP). The agency was
informed that starting January 1, 2024, interim and renewal audit CAP's will be
reviewed with the agency at three months and six months. The assigned
Consultant for the agency will work with the agency in conducting CAP reviews.
This process for special investigation CAP reviews was implemented previously.
• Rule 400.12209 (2) (a) Orientation and Training. The agency was
informed that all the training requirements listed under (2) (a) are required yearly
for foster care workers carrying a caseload as well as for supervisors who may
be carrying a caseload.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or provided at this time.
2

VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows: The
agency submitted one corrective action plan on 10-2-23 in response to those
violations established during the renewal audit completed on 8-14-23. The renewal
audit established the following rule and policy violations: R 400.12326 Borrowed
Home, R 400.12306 Application request, R 400.12413 Medical and Dental, FOM
722-08D Treatment Plans, and FOM 801-03 Medical Passports. The current
Interim inspection did not establish any repeat violations indicating the agency
CAP was successful in preventing repeat violations.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators Assessment was reviewed. The assessment thoroughly
addressed the citations and CAP from the 2023 renewal inspection. The
assessment identified a few late reports, FTM's, and medicals and steps to correct
the areas of non-compliance were documented. The agency conducts case reads,
and monthly reviews of the CAP at team meetings. The assessment also stated
that supervisory case consultation has assisted in achieving compliance with the
rules and policy.
Financial Overview
The agency is a local DHHS office and financial records were not available.
Staff Interviews
Staff reported feeling supported by their respective supervisors and agency
administration. Staff reported that the agency experiences little staff turnover and
they feel that is because there is a solid, supportive team that works well together.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern, well maintained local DHHS office. There is
sufficient office space. CHRI documents were observed to be secured
appropriately.
3

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The CPA Analyst identified three safety alerts during her visits to the homes. They
are as follows:
Safety Alert #1 A safety alert was generated on 08-06-24 as the home was missing
a smoke alarm between the children's bedroom and the master bedroom and the
rest of the home.
Resolution: Resolution was obtained on 8-8-24 as an alarm was installed and
photos were provided.
Safety Alert #2. A safety alert was generated on 8-6-24 as a smoke alarm was
missing between the children's bedroom and the rest of the home.
Resolution: Resolution was obtained on 8-8-24 as an alarm was installed and
photos provided.
Safety Alert #3. A safety alert was generated on 8-13-24 as a smoke alarm was not
installed in the basement of the home.
Resolution: Resolution was obtained on 8-14-24 as an alarm was installed and
photos provided.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
October 3, 2024
________________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
